topic.title: Other things you can do with project files

body.p: There are a couple of other things you can do with project files. You can publish deliverables from several different project files at once, or just one deliverable from a project file containing several. You can also use the DITA deliverables command as a quick and easy way to see what deliverables a project file contains.

section.title: Using multiple project files together
section.p: The project file syntax also incorporates an <include> element which you can use to chain several project files together and produce all their deliverables in one go. See the following example, all_deliverables.xml:
section.codeblock:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <?xml-model href="https://www.dita-ot.org/rng/project.rnc" type="application/relax-ng-compact-syntax"?>
<project xmlns="https://www.dita-ot.org/project">
<include href="product1_deilverables.xml"/> <include href="product2_deilverables.xml"/> <include href="product3_deilverables.xml"/>
</project>

section.title: Building a single deliverable from a project file
section.p: If you only want to build a single deliverable and you know that its build parameters are contained in a certain project file you can pass the deliverable's unique ID to the --deliverable switch with the DITA build command.
